item.title: Biden Has 65 Days Left in Office. Here’s What He Can Do on Criminal Justice.
item.description: Judicial appointments and the death penalty are among areas where a lame-duck administration can still leave a mark.

item.title: 10 Stories That Defined The Marshall Project’s First 10 Years
item.description: For a decade, our journalism has driven change and delivered information to millions, including people behind bars. We’re just getting started.

item.title: Jackson, Mississippi, Officials Aren’t the First to Stay in Office Amid Corruption Charges
item.description: Hinds County District Attorney Jody E. Owens II and Jackson Mayor Chokwe Antar Lumumba vow to fight federal corruption charges and not step down.

item.title: This Motivational Speaker Faced Down a Tough Crowd: Fellow Lifers
item.description: Over 27 years behind bars, Bobby Bostic learned to inspire people in dark places. It all started with the “complete failure” of his first big speech.

item.title: 3 Things to Know About Prison Violence Against Transgender People
item.description: Key takeaways from our story about one trans woman’s legal battle for accountability.
